title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: Drylaw had been enjoined by the captain to enlarge no manother than Kennedy, but when we would have had him out, hewould not budge unless another prisoner in the cell with him, aseafaring man, that had once done him a gude turn, was alsofreed. Drylaw stormed and swore, and Red Pow raged, so thatI saw that gif something was not done we might lose our labour. I cared little whether the man won out or no, but as there wasno other means to get my friend away, I gave the fellow theword, and dropped the lanthron, and in that fashion heescaped.

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: Howbeit, though it came off well, it was like at onetime, by reason of Red Pow's obstinacy, to have miscarried. Drylaw had been enjoined by the captain to enlarge no manother than Kennedy, but when we would have had him out, hewould not budge unless another prisoner in the cell with him, aseafaring man, that had once done him a gude turn, was alsofreed. Drylaw stormed and swore, and Red Pow raged, so thatI saw that gif something was not done we might lose our labour.

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: Gordon inthe North and Kirkaldy in the South had more than held theirain ; but the massacre of St. Bartholomew, and the craft ofMorton, at last crippled us. The first caused the hearts of thepeople to turn from our cause just as they were being knit tous, and the last weaned the lords from their allegiance, so thatsave the Secretar, the captain, lord Hume, the laird of Drylawand some few others of lesser note, no man of name held to us.

title: Skagboys
author: Welsh, Irvine
snippet: 311boozer. Alison remembered that one: it was rumoured to be three guysfrom Drylaw, but they were never found.

title: Skagboys
author: Welsh, Irvine
snippet: The group of assailants quicklydeparted, with instructions to staff and regulars of what to tell the police. The consensus was that three Jambos from Drylaw perpetuated the damageto the landlord and his property.

title: Skagboys
author: Welsh, Irvine
snippet: — Saw his mate Begbie in the Tam O'Shanter the other day, gaun oanabout some cunts fae Drylaw that did his Uncle Dickie, Lenny smiledslyly, fixing Billy in his gaze, — Jambos seemingly, he half jokingly accused. — Spat on Joe Baker's picture, so Dickie got stroppy n pilled them up.
